page.title: 04LAVEDDON NURSERY
page.content: The nursery got its name from John Laveddon, a former mayor of Bodmin. It covers 8 acres of land and consists of 7 greenhouses. Four people work there - two full time - two part time. Mr and Mrs. King who own the nursery also work there. The workers range from 18-50, years old. The most popular kind of plant is the Fuchsia. The most expensive plant is the Weeping Purple Beach; it costs Â£11.00. Eighteen kinds of bedding plants are sold at the nursery. All the plants are watered by hosepipe. In the summer, the average number of people visiting the nursery in one day is about 75 - in winter about 30. The average number of plants sold in a year is 350,000. Near the nursery is a stream which forms part of the parish boundry.
